lessons.title: Introduction to Python
lessons.objective: Understand what Python is and why it's used.
content: Python is a high-level, interpreted language.
It's used in web development, data science, and AI.
It’s known for its clean and beginner-friendly syntax.
code_examples:
name = input('Enter your name: ')
print('Hello', name)

lessons.title: Variables and Data Types
lessons.objective: Learn how to store and work with different data types.
content: Variables store values.
Python has int, float, str, bool types.
Dynamic typing means no need to declare type.
tasks: Use type() to check their types.

lessons.title: Basic Operations
lessons.objective: Learn how to use basic operators in Python.
content: Python supports arithmetic, comparison, and logical operators.
Operators are used to perform operations on variables and values.
tasks: Compare two numbers using comparison operators.

lessons.title: If-Else Statements
lessons.objective: Learn how to use conditional statements.
content: If statements allow you to run code only when a condition is true.
Else runs code when the condition is false.
tasks: Check whether a number is even or odd.

lessons.title: Loops
lessons.objective: Learn about for and while loops in Python.
content: Loops help you repeat actions without writing code multiple times.
Python has for and while loops.
tasks: Create a loop to print numbers 1 to 10.
Use a while loop to print even numbers.

lessons.title: Functions
lessons.objective: Learn how to define and call functions.
content: Functions let you organize and reuse code.
Use def keyword to define a function.
tasks: Create a function that prints a greeting.
Write a function that adds two numbers.

lessons.title: Lists and Tuples
lessons.objective: Learn how to work with lists and tuples.
content: Lists are mutable collections.
Tuples are immutable collections.
tasks: Access and modify elements in the list.

lessons.title: Dictionaries and Sets
lessons.objective: Understand dictionaries and sets in Python.
content: Dictionaries store key-value pairs.
Sets store unique elements.
tasks: Create a dictionary of personal info.
Create a set and add/remove elements.

lessons.title: Introduction to Frontend
lessons.objective: Understand what frontend development is and tools used.
content: Frontend development deals with the visual part of a website.
Technologies include HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
tasks: Install a code editor (like VS Code).
Write and open it in a browser.

lessons.title: Basic HTML Structure
lessons.objective: Learn the basic structure of an HTML page.
content: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language.
It provides the structure for web pages.
tasks: Add a heading and a paragraph.

lessons.title: Introduction to CSS
lessons.objective: Learn how to style HTML elements.
content: CSS adds style and layout to web pages.
It can be inline, internal, or external.
tasks: Change the color of text using CSS.
Add background color to your page.

lessons.title: Selectors and Properties
lessons.objective: Understand CSS selectors and common properties.
content: Selectors target HTML elements.
Properties define styles for those elements.

lessons.title: Introduction to JavaScript
lessons.objective: Learn what JavaScript is and how to use it.
content: JavaScript adds interactivity to web pages.
It runs in the browser.
tasks: Add a script to your HTML page.
Print a message in the browser console.

lessons.title: Variables and Functions
lessons.objective: Learn how to use variables and functions in JS.
content: Use let, const to declare variables.
Functions group reusable code.
tasks: Create a function to greet a user.
Change the value of a variable and print it.

lessons.title: Introduction to AI and ML
lessons.objective: Understand what AI and ML are and why they matter.
content: AI is the simulation of human intelligence in machines.
ML is a subset of AI that enables systems to learn from data.
AI/ML powers applications like recommendation systems and chatbots.
tasks: Understand the difference between AI and ML.

lessons.title: Environment Setup
lessons.objective: Set up tools needed for AI/ML development.
content: Install Python, Jupyter Notebook, and essential libraries.
We'll use NumPy, Pandas, and Matplotlib.
code_examples: pip install numpy pandas matplotlib jupyter

lessons.title: NumPy Basics
lessons.objective: Learn how to work with numerical data using NumPy.
content: NumPy is used for numerical computations.
It provides powerful array operations.
code_examples:
import numpy as np
arr = np.array([1,2,3])
print(arr)

lessons.title: Pandas Basics
lessons.objective: Work with structured data using Pandas.
content: Pandas provides Series and DataFrame structures.
It's widely used in data analysis.
code_examples:
import pandas as pd
df = pd.DataFrame({'Name':['Ada','John'],'Age':[25,30]})
print(df)
tasks: Read a CSV file if possible.

lessons.title: Understanding Machine Learning
lessons.objective: Understand how ML works conceptually.
content: ML learns patterns from data.
You train a model and make predictions.
tasks: Explain what training and testing mean.

lessons.title: Scikit-Learn Setup
lessons.objective: Install and explore Scikit-Learn.
content: Scikit-Learn is a popular ML library.
It makes building models easier.
